question_text: What does the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration do?

mcq_options.text: It links to a DTD file
It tells the browser to use standards mode (HTML5)
It comments out the document type

answer_explanation: Declares HTML5 document type and triggers standards mode.

question_text: Which CSS property controls the space between an element's content and its border?
answer_explanation: padding is the inner spacing between content and border.

question_text: Which tag is used for the largest heading in HTML5?
answer_explanation: <h1> denotes the largest heading.

question_text: What does the box-sizing: border-box; property do?

mcq_options.text: Includes padding and border in element's width/height

answer_explanation: border-box makes width/height include padding and border.

question_text: What attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image?
answer_explanation: alt provides alternative text for accessibility and when image fails to load.

question_text: Which CSS selector targets elements with class 'btn'?
answer_explanation: .btn selects elements that have class="btn".

question_text: Which element is semantic and used to define navigation links?
answer_explanation: <nav> is a semantic element for navigation links.

question_text: Which display value makes an element a block-level element that doesn't start a new line?
answer_explanation: inline-block allows block-style sizing while flowing inline.

question_text: Which attribute specifies the URL of a linked resource in an <a> tag?
answer_explanation: href holds the link destination in anchor tags.

question_text: How do you center an element horizontally with margin auto?

mcq_options.text: display:block and set width and margin:0 auto

answer_explanation: Set a width and margin: 0 auto on a block element to center it.

question_text: How do you make an input field required in HTML5?
answer_explanation: Use the required attribute to require a value before form submission.

question_text: Which property controls stacking order of positioned elements?
answer_explanation: z-index sets stacking order when position is not static.

question_text: Which element is used to embed JavaScript in HTML?
answer_explanation: <script> is used to include or embed JavaScript.

question_text: Which unit is relative to the root element font-size?
answer_explanation: rem units are relative to the root (html) font-size.

question_text: Which element is used for the main content of a document?
answer_explanation: <main> denotes the primary content area of the document.

question_text: What does flex: 1 do on a flex item?

mcq_options.text: Sets flex-basis to 0 and allows item to grow

answer_explanation: flex:1 allows the item to grow and share space in the flex container.

question_text: Which tag is appropriate for marking up a self-contained composition like a blog post?
answer_explanation: <article> represents a self-contained composition such as a post.

question_text: How do you create a CSS Grid with two equal columns?
answer_explanation: Use grid-template-columns with fractional units to define columns.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <meta name="viewport"> tag?
answer_explanation: Meta viewport controls layout on mobile devices for responsive design.

question_text: Which property would you use to change the default font of a page?
answer_explanation: font-family sets typeface for text content.

question_text: Which attribute on <form> specifies the HTTP method for submission?
answer_explanation: method sets HTTP method (GET or POST) for the form submission.

question_text: How do you apply a CSS rule only when the viewport is narrower than 600px?
answer_explanation: @media max-width applies rules for narrow viewports.

question_text: How do you include an external CSS file in HTML?
answer_explanation: Use <link rel="stylesheet" href="..."> to include external CSS.

question_text: Which pseudo-class applies when a user hovers over an element?
answer_explanation: :hover styles elements during pointer hover.

question_text: Which tag is used to define a table row?
answer_explanation: <tr> defines a table row; <td> defines table cells.

question_text: Which property makes an element transparent?
answer_explanation: opacity sets transparency while keeping element in flow.

question_text: Which attribute on <script> can be used to defer execution until after parsing?
answer_explanation: defer delays script execution until after the document is parsed.

question_text: How do you create a CSS variable?
answer_explanation: Custom properties are declared with --name in CSS.

question_text: What element should be used for side content like pull quotes or ads?
answer_explanation: <aside> is for tangential content such as sidebars.

question_text: What selector targets direct children only?
answer_explanation: The > combinator selects direct child elements.

question_text: Which input type provides a dropdown list of options?
answer_explanation: <select> creates a dropdown; <option> items supply choices.

question_text: Which property controls how text wraps inside an element?
answer_explanation: overflow-wrap (formerly word-wrap) controls text wrapping to avoid overflow.

question_text: Which HTML attribute is used to specify inline CSS styles?
answer_explanation: The style attribute sets inline CSS for an element.

question_text: What is specificity affected by?
answer_explanation: Specificity is calculated from inline styles, IDs, classes, and element counts.

question_text: Which tag is used to define a block of preformatted text?
answer_explanation: <pre> preserves whitespace and displays preformatted text.

question_text: Which property stops an element from shrinking in flexbox?
answer_explanation: flex-shrink:0 prevents item from shrinking when space is limited.

question_text: What is semantic HTML?

mcq_options.text: Use of tags for styling only
Using meaningful tags that describe content

answer_explanation: Semantic HTML uses elements that convey meaning, improving accessibility and SEO.

question_text: How do you make an element stick to the top during scroll using CSS?
answer_explanation: position: sticky with top value makes element stick within its container.

question_text: Which attribute on <a> opens link in a new tab/window?
answer_explanation: target="_blank" opens the link in a new tab or window.

question_text: Which CSS rule hides an element but keeps it accessible to screen readers?

mcq_options.text: clip-path and position to visually hide

answer_explanation: Using off-screen or clipping techniques keeps it accessible; visibility:hidden and display:none remove from accessibility tree.

question_text: Which element provides a caption for a <figure>?
answer_explanation: <figcaption> labels the content of a <figure>.

question_text: What is the effect of transform: translateZ(0)?
answer_explanation: translateZ(0) often promotes element to its own layer for smoother rendering.

question_text: Which tag is used to embed a video in HTML5?
answer_explanation: <video> is the HTML5 element for embedding video content.

question_text: Which property is used to control spacing between flex items?
answer_explanation: gap sets spacing between flex or grid items.

question_text: Which attribute is used to specify language of the document?
answer_explanation: The lang attribute on <html> specifies the document language.

question_text: Which pseudo-element selects the first line of a block of text?
answer_explanation: ::first-line targets the first formatted line.

question_text: How do you mark up a list of navigation links semantically?
answer_explanation: Use <nav> containing a list (<ul>/<ol>) of links for navigation.

question_text: How do you create a responsive image that scales with its container?
answer_explanation: max-width:100% with height:auto scales image responsively.

question_text: Which element is appropriate to contain a website's footer information?
answer_explanation: <footer> denotes footer content for a document or section.

question_text: Which property controls whether an element's content may be scrolled?
answer_explanation: overflow controls scroll behavior and overflow handling.

question_text: Which attribute on <input> specifies maximum allowed length?
answer_explanation: maxlength limits the number of characters accepted in text inputs.

question_text: Which unit is relative to the viewport width?
answer_explanation: vw is viewport width unit; vh is viewport height.

question_text: What does <base href> element do?

mcq_options.text: Sets base URL for relative links

answer_explanation: <base> sets a base URL for resolving relative URLs in the document.

question_text: What does the CSS 'contain' property do?

mcq_options.text: Improves performance by limiting browser scope for layout/paint

answer_explanation: contain helps the browser optimize by isolating layout/paint/size.

question_text: Which HTML element is used to represent contact information for the author or owner?
answer_explanation: <address> provides contact information.

question_text: Which property makes text truncate with ellipsis?

mcq_options.text: text-overflow: ellipsis; overflow: hidden; white-space: nowrap;

answer_explanation: Combine text-overflow, overflow, and white-space to show ellipsis.

question_text: Which attribute tells the browser to autoplay a video?
answer_explanation: autoplay attribute makes media start playing automatically (with browser restrictions).

question_text: How do you apply a style to every odd row in a table?
answer_explanation: nth-child(odd) selects odd-indexed children (1-based indexing).

question_text: How do you specify multiple alternative sources for a media element?
answer_explanation: Use multiple <source> children inside <video> or <audio> for fallbacks.

question_text: Which display property turns an element into a flex container?
answer_explanation: display:flex activates flex layout on the container.

question_text: Which element is best for marking up a blog post comment?
answer_explanation: Comments are self-contained and can use <article> or semantic containers.

question_text: What does the 'object-fit' property control for replaced elements like images?

mcq_options.text: How the content fills its box (cover, contain)

answer_explanation: object-fit controls how replaced content is resized to fit its container.

question_text: What attribute is used to hint to the browser for autocomplete on form fields?
answer_explanation: autocomplete suggests stored values for form controls.

question_text: Which property controls the distance between lines of text?
answer_explanation: line-height sets vertical spacing between lines.

question_text: Which HTTP method should be used for form submissions that change server state?
answer_explanation: POST is used when submitting data that alters server state.

question_text: Which selector matches an element with id 'main'?
answer_explanation: #id selects element by id.

question_text: What is ARIA used for in HTML?

mcq_options.text: Improving accessibility through roles and properties

answer_explanation: ARIA supplies accessibility metadata for assistive technologies.

question_text: How do you make CSS animation run infinitely?
answer_explanation: Use animation-iteration-count: infinite to loop animations.

question_text: Which element is recommended for embedding third-party interactive content like maps?
answer_explanation: <iframe> isolates and embeds external interactive content.

question_text: What is the default value of 'position' property?
answer_explanation: position defaults to static.

question_text: How do you make a checkbox checked by default?
answer_explanation: Include the checked attribute on the input to make it checked initially.

question_text: Which property sets the transparency of background color separately from content?
answer_explanation: Use rgba()/hsla() alpha channel to set background transparency without affecting children.

question_text: Which attribute specifies where to send form-data on submission?
answer_explanation: action specifies the URL that processes the form data.

question_text: Which CSS function allows you to calculate values like widths?
answer_explanation: calc() evaluates expressions combining units.

question_text: Which meta tag can prevent search engines from indexing a page?
answer_explanation: Use meta robots noindex to request search engines not to index a page.

question_text: Which pseudo-class targets input elements that are invalid according to constraints?
answer_explanation: :invalid styles form controls failing validation.

question_text: Which element should you use for marking up a navigation menu item label visually hidden but accessible to screen readers?

mcq_options.text: Use .sr-only class and keep in DOM

answer_explanation: Visually hide via CSS but keep element accessible for screen readers (e.g., .sr-only).

question_text: How do you make text unselectable by the user using CSS?
answer_explanation: user-select: none prevents text selection.

question_text: Which element allows you to provide fallback content if browser doesn't support certain features?
answer_explanation: <noscript> displays content when scripts are disabled or unsupported.

question_text: Which property affects whether flex items wrap to the next line?
answer_explanation: flex-wrap controls wrapping behavior in a flex container.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <template> element in HTML?

mcq_options.text: Store HTML fragments not rendered until instantiated

answer_explanation: <template> holds inert DOM fragments that can be cloned for later use.

question_text: What is the purpose of :root selector in CSS?

mcq_options.text: : Targets top-level root element for variables and global styles

answer_explanation: :root targets the root element (html) commonly used for custom properties.

question_text: Which attribute on is used to provide multiple images for responsive displays?
answer_explanation: srcset provides different image sources for different resolutions.

question_text: Which CSS rule applies when two conflicting declarations have equal specificity?

mcq_options.text: Last one in source order wins

answer_explanation: When specificity ties, the latter declaration overrides earlier ones.

question_text: Which element represents a dialog box or window?
answer_explanation: <dialog> represents a dialog.

question_text: How do you vertically center a single-line text inside a fixed-height div using line-height?

mcq_options.text: Set line-height equal to div's height

answer_explanation: Setting line-height equal to container height centers single-line inline text.

question_text: How do you mark an element as the site logo semantically?
answer_explanation: Place logo in header with appropriate alt and aria attributes for semantics.

question_text: Which pseudo-class matches when an element has focus via keyboard navigation?
answer_explanation: :focus-visible indicates focus ring typically from keyboard navigation.

question_text: Which attribute is commonly used to store custom data on elements?
answer_explanation: data-* attributes store custom, private data for scripts.

question_text: How do you create a linear gradient background?
answer_explanation: Use linear-gradient to define gradient backgrounds.

question_text: Which tag can be used to define navigation breadcrumbs semantically?
answer_explanation: Use nav with aria-label and list markup for accessible breadcrumbs.

question_text: Which property is used to add a drop shadow to an element?
answer_explanation: box-shadow adds shadow to element box (filter:drop-shadow also exists).

question_text: Which HTML tag is used to define a client-side script that should not execute until explicitly run?
answer_explanation: Using a non-JS script type (e.g., text/template) keeps it inert until parsed.

question_text: How do you make an element invisible but still take up layout space?
answer_explanation: visibility:hidden hides while preserving layout space.

question_text: Which attribute on <a> should you use alongside target="_blank" for security?
answer_explanation: rel="noopener noreferrer" prevents the new page from accessing window.opener and improves security.

question_text: Which property is useful for hardware-accelerated animations?
answer_explanation: will-change hints the browser to optimize for upcoming changes.

question_text: Which HTML element provides a native tooltip on hover?
answer_explanation: title attribute shows a native browser tooltip on hover.

question_text: How do you apply a transition when a property changes?
answer_explanation: transition defines property, duration, and timing function for smooth changes.

question_text: What is the use of <progress> element?

mcq_options.text: Create progress bar using JS only

answer_explanation: <progress> represents completion progress of a task.

question_text: Which property specifies the order of flex items visually?
answer_explanation: order reorders flex items without changing source order.
